title: (x) Crossed "L" "V" in pattern of Louis Vuitton bags - custom drawn {Yves}
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20130707145543im_/http:/typophile.com/files/LV_Icon_4541.png)
  
Hello:  
I'd like to know what is the typeface of the L and V letters used in the pattern.  
The logo "Louis Vuitton" is easier to recognize for me: futura.  
However,this one is a difficult one. "L" is italice, but "V" is none. Could it be also a very classical typeface or it is a special design by the designer?  
Does anyone have any clue about it?
author: Kai Boon

comments.content:
This is no typeface, but a custom designed logo. Only these two characters were drawn.

So, for how much are you going to sell your counterfeit bags? :^P

so i have to draw by myself ... it's a good challenge!  
of course latter i'll sell it a lot! it will be a piece of "art work"  
but inspired by Mr.Vuitton waaaaaa
How did it go? I'm working on some re-drawing of the Type face myself
